newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan torrential rains kill four, cost T$1.5 bln.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan torrential rains kill four, cost T$1.5 bln.

text.p: Heavy torrential rains in southern Taiwan since June 30 have taken four lives and caused T$1.5 billion in farms and crops damages, Council of Agriculture officials said on Thursday.
"The (farms) losses have reached T$1.5 billion," a council official said by telephone.
The torrential rains had swept through most of the southern island and flooded many farmlands, with southern counties of Tainan and Yunlin being hardest hit.
Four people were killed and two othere were missing because of the rains, the official said.
Taiwan's retail fruits and vegetable prices are expected to rise by about 15 percent later this week as the result of the farm damages, he said.
The council has urged local governments to offer emergency assistance to farmers who had suffered rain-related losses.

The rains also flooded the construction sites in the southern Tainan Science-Based Park, where major Taiwan's electronic firms, including United Microelectronics and Taiwan Semiconductor, are planning to build multi-billion-dollar semiconductor projects, local media said.
The exact damages were not immediately known.
